ViewDef.Title: VM Memory Allocation Trend
ViewDef.Description: Trend line of VM growth. It shows both the powered on and powered off, to see the relative movement over time

ViewDef.Title: VM Network Top Talkers
ViewDef.Description: List of VMs that use the most bandwidth in both 5 minute and 1 day. To help you focus on the VMs that hit the network hard, VMs that are not hitting the network hard is filtered out. The threshold used is 1 MB/s sustained in the last collection cycle.

ViewDef.Title: VM Memory to reclaim (idle)
ViewDef.Description: Count of Idle VMs, grouped by the amount of RAM to be added, as per Capacity Engine recommendation.

ViewDef.Title: VM Memory Contention Distribution for Profiling
ViewDef.Description: Distribution of VMs by their memory performance. It's using the 20 second, not the 5 minute average. The 99.9th value of the monitoring period is shown (as opposed to the worst). The bar chart is segregated into 10 buckets, so you can better see the spread. Each bucket is color coded, showing different threshold.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Port Group Configuration
ViewDef.Description: List of distributed port groups and their key properties.

ViewDef.Title: ESXi Distribution by NIC Speed
ViewDef.Description: Relative distribution of ESXi physical network card speed. Use 25 Gb NIC or higher for faster performance, especially if ESXi runs distributed storage. Keep the total number of combination minimal as a high number complicate operations. Also, check ESXi with < 10 Gb NIC.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster DRS Automation Status
ViewDef.Description: Relative distribution of clusters DRS automation level. You should set DRS to be fully automated, so adjustment can be done without the need for operator intervention. As DRS adjusts every 5 minutes, by the time human reacts the situation may have changed. Too aggressive or too conservative can also result in suboptimal performance or capacity.

ViewDef.Title: VM Distribution by Reclaimable CPU
ViewDef.Description: Count of VMs, grouped by the amount of vCPU that can be reclaimed, as per Capacity Engine recommendation. Give the engine time enough predictable cycles for better prediction. A VM with month-end cycle will need 3 months.

ViewDef.Title: vSphere Cluster DRS Status
ViewDef.Description: vSphere Cluster DRS configuration status, where true = enabled.

ViewDef.Title: VM Distribution by CPU Reservation
ViewDef.Description: Relative distribution of VM CPU reservation. A VM reservation impacts DRS behaviour and reduce Capacity, hence resulting in less optimal environment.

ViewDef.Title: VM Distribution by Memory to add
ViewDef.Description: Count of VMs, grouped by the amount of RAM to be added, as per Capacity Engine recommendation. Give the engine time enough predictable cycles for better prediction. A VM with month-end cycle will need 3 months.
